conclusion: The electric field E is horizontal and the ball moves along a straight line at an angle θ to the opposite direction of the electric field.
The electric force Fe acts horizontally and is given by Fe = qE, where q is the charge of the ball.
The vertical component of the electric force is zero, so the electric force does not do any work along the vertical direction.
Therefore, the change in electric potential energy ΔUe is zero.
The difference in electric potential energy of the small ball when it reaches the highest point compared to its electric potential energy at point O is 0.
